sentences: Trouble Maker (Korean: 트러블 메이커) is a South Korean duo formed by Cube Entertainment in 2011, composed of Hyunseung and Hyuna.

== Career == | === 2011: Formation and debut with Trouble Maker ===

sentences: In November 2011, Cube Entertainment labelmates Hyun-seung (former member of Beast) and Hyuna (former member of 4Minute and Wonder Girls) formed the duo Trouble Maker.
section: == Career == | === 2011: Formation and debut with Trouble Maker ===

sentences: Hyuna had previously released two singles, but both described the sub-unit as something different to either of their respective groups.
section: == Career == | === 2011: Formation and debut with Trouble Maker ===

sentences: The sub-unit was officially billed as 'JS & Hyuna', which Hyun-seung went on to reveal on his Twitter included his new stage name for the subunit, Jay Stomp.
section: == Career == | === 2011: Formation and debut with Trouble Maker ===

sentences: On November 25, the unit started revealing teaser photos for the album, revealing a private-party concept.
section: == Career == | === 2011: Formation and debut with Trouble Maker ===

sentences: The duo also gave a teaser performance at the 2011 Mnet Asian Music Awards, which included an on-stage kiss.
section: == Career == | === 2011: Formation and debut with Trouble Maker ===

sentences: The duo's first mini-album and single, both eponymously titled "Trouble Maker", were released on December 1, 2011.
section: == Career == | === 2011: Formation and debut with Trouble Maker ===

sentences: The duo's live performances of "Trouble Maker" on weekly music shows were criticized by the Korean media for their sexually suggestive choreography.
section: == Career == | === 2011: Formation and debut with Trouble Maker ===

sentences: In response, Cube Entertainment altered the choreography for the rest of the promotion period of "Trouble Maker".
section: == Career == | === 2011: Formation and debut with Trouble Maker ===

sentences: The duo also performed "Trouble Maker" at the United Cube concerts in London and Brazil in December 2011.

section: == Career == | === 2011: Formation and debut with Trouble Maker ===

sentences: Chemistry ===
In October 2013, Cube Entertainment confirmed Trouble Maker's upcoming comeback with a racy photoshoot.
On October 28, the group released the single "Now" from its Chemistry EP.
The single's music video, which drew inspiration from serial criminals Bonnie and Clyde, earned a 19+ rating for its heavy references to sex, alcohol, and cigarettes.
"Now" had the highest score ever recorded on music show Inkigayo, maxing out at 11,000 points.
Departures ===
On September 13, Hyuna was announced to have been removed from Cube Entertainment alongside Pentagon's E'Dawn, following the announcement they had been dating.
The next day, Cube withdrew the decision due to severe backlash from fans and a drop in stocks, and announced they would further discuss it with the two.
On October 5, it was announced Hyuna would end her contract with Cube due to Cube's previous violation.
On August 2, 2021, Hyunseung also left Cube Entertainment.
Both members had left the label, however, the group has not officially disbanded.
